definition: not worthwhile
to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)
(negative prefix)/not/no
(chess) move/trick/all right!/(dialect) to add
to wear (clothes)/to contact/to use/to apply
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: You're wasting your time with me.
sentences.chinese: 犯不着把时间浪费在我这儿。

sentences.english: I wonder, the word 'Please' could make you shit on my body.
sentences.chinese: 我不过是说了个请字，犯不着拉屎在我头上吧？

sentences.english: It isn't worthwhile spending so much time on minor problems.
sentences.chinese: 在枝节问题上犯不着花这么多时间。

sentences.english: You didn't have to tell everybody.
It is beneath you to complain.
P46:You don't have to be poor to be lonely.
sentences.chinese: 你犯不着因为贫穷而感到孤独。

sentences.english: ‘You don’t want to have any pity on these tramps—scum, they are.
sentences.chinese: 你犯不着可怜这些流浪汉，这都是些瘪三。

definition: see 犯不著|犯不着[fan4 bu5 zhao2]
worthwhile (often in rhetorical questions, implying not worthwhile)/also written 犯得上
there is no need/why should
why bother?/is it worth the trouble?
to avoid/so as to save (money or time)
to lower oneself to sb's level/to argue with sb less well-informed
unworthy
to go to war (idiom)/to make a big fuss over sth
need not/unnecessary
at worst/if worst comes to worst/serious/alarming
to make life difficult for/to embarrass/unable to make it through
to muster large forces/to get a great number of people involved (in carrying out some task)
to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
thus/in this way/like this
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
